title: Preview: Girls’ soccer to kick off league season against Los Altos
content: The Palo Alto High School girls' soccer team (6-0-0) will open its league season with a challenging game against Los Altos High School (1-5-0) at 3:30 p.m. tomorrow at Los Altos High School. Paly ended it pre-season on Monday by winning against Gunn High School in its last non-league game 6-0. The team is hopeful for a win against Los Altos after tying the team 2-2 in its first league game last year. "Los Altos has been a tough team for us in past seasons," assistant coach Eric Seedman said. "Even when we have outplayed them, we've had trouble getting wins." Seedman feels that the team needs to improve its offensive attack and better act on opportunities to score. "The team can lose focus at times, especially when we have a lead in the game," Seedman said. "Some games we have struggled to finish easy chances." According to Seedman, although the Los Altos team returns many quality players from last season, it also welcomes a new coach. Seedman said he is unsure of what to expect based on Los Altos's pre-season.  "They [Los Altos] had an odd selection of pre-season games, with opponents from outside of CCS [Central Coast Section] for the most part, so we do not know how to gauge their results," Seedman said. Paly will enter this game with a strong pre-season with a total of 25 goals in 6 games, according to junior co-captain and defensive midfielder Jacey Pederson. "This pre-season has been the best pre-season we've had as a team all of the years I've been in the program," Pederson said. Pederson is looking forward to the match with confidence. "In the past, we have struggled against Los Altos,"  Pederson said. "But I have faith that this year we can come out strong and get the result [we want]."

excerpt: Despite a slow finish, the Palo Alto High boys' basketball team (9-2, 0-0) managed to keep its lead, winning its first league game against Fremont High School (6-8, 0-0) with a final score of 58-44.
author: Claire Krugler

title: Slideshow: Boys’ soccer defeat rival Gunn
content: Palo Alto High School boys' soccer team (4-1-2) beat rival Gunn High School (3-4-1) 3-0 in its last preseason match yesterday at home. Senior forward Edward Chen scored the first goal of the game in the first half. In the second half, sophomore midfielder Brian Tracy scored the second goal for Paly, followed soon after by a header goal by junior midfielder Dami Bolarinwa off of a corner kick by senior captain and center midfielder Wesley Woo. “3-0 kind of seems like a blowout, but it was a hard game,” Chen said. “We had huge expectations and I think we did well.” The Vikings will next take on Los Altos in their first league game at 3:30 p.m. Thursday at home. Correction - 9:32 p.m.  Jan. 7 2015 : The originally published league records for Palo Alto High School and Gunn High School, (1-0-2) and (3-1-1), respectively, were incorrect. The article has since been updated to reflect the current standings of each team. [slideshow post_id=80649]

title: Slideshow: Girls’ soccer shuts out Gunn
content:
The Palo Alto High School girls' soccer team (6-0) shut out cross-town rival Gunn High School (2-2-1), 6-0, in Saturday's game at Gunn.

Paly pulled ahead in the first half with four goals and solidly finished with a final two goals scored in the second half. Midfielder juniors Jacey Pederson and Nika Woodfill both scored two goals and midfielders senior Katie Foug and sophomore Tess Preising scored one each.

The Vikings will next take on Los Altos High School at 3:30 p.m. on Jan. 8 at Los Altos.

title: PAUSD reaches settlement agreement in construction lawsuit
content: The Palo Alto Unified School District has agreed to pay $540,000 to settle a $3.8 million lawsuit regarding a breach of contract during the construction of the Media Arts Center and the Math and Social Studies Building at Palo Alto High School. The cost of construction for the two buildings came in under budget even after the settlement, according to a press release from PAUSD. "This settlement puts an end to the legal process and attorney fees," Supt. Max McGee said in the press release. "Even after paying the settlement amount, this project came in under budget, and the remaining amount can be put to further improvements on the campus." Assistant Principal Jerry Berkson is delighted by the news as it provides money to be spent on future projects to upgrade the campus. "It's good news because we had to set aside $3.5 million just in case we lost the whole thing [lawsuit]," Berkson said. "With us only having to pay around $500,000, all the money comes back, and we can put it towards other projects." The specific use of the left over money has yet to be decided on. However, it will be used toward improving the Paly campus as a part of the Strong Schools Bond Program according to Berkson. "There's a lot of decision-making going on right now," Berkson said. "We have the new gym coming up, the library project, the science project and we have several smaller projects that would be great with that money. Once the big projects are finished, we may also do some internal construction in some of the buildings. But down the line, any of those would have to be voted on to spend the money." The lawsuit filed by Taisei Construction Corporation was in the amount of $3,793,000 against PAUSD, Deem Lewis McKinley Architecture and the construction manager Gilbane. The settlement has been reached by all parties with payments from each, according to the press release.
excerpt: The Palo Alto Unified School District has agreed to pay $540,000 to settle a $3.5 million lawsuit regarding a breach of contract during the construction of two new Palo Alto High School buildings.
